alert.note: Alert for Gibson; Pike; Posey; Spencer; Vanderburgh; Warrick (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued December 15 at 5:27AM EST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...HEAVY RAINS EXPECTED THURSDAY AND FRIDAY... A cold front will approach and bring rain, including a chance of thunderstorms, to the area by Thursday. The front will slowly move across the region through the day Thursday, with the front settling along or just to our south Thursday night. One half inch to one inch of rainfall is expected through Thursday night. On Friday, we see the front return as a warm front, and activate rains again, with another chance of thunderstorms. The rain and storm chance continues until the entire system can be swept out by another cold front early this weekend. An additional 1 to 2 inches of rain, with locally higher amounts, is expected Friday through Saturday morning. Total average storm rainfall forecast is 2 to 3 inches, but localized higher totals may push that into the mid 3 inch range. Even though we have been dry lately, this amount of rainfall may at least cause localized flooding issues. Be aware of the potential flooding threat and related impacts of these heavy rains, and understand that locally higher totals could aggravate flooding.

area.areaDesc: Gibson; Pike; Posey; Spencer; Vanderburgh; Warrick
